properties.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 5 at 7:53AM MST until February 8 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Cheyenne WY
properties.description:
...BLOWING AND DRIFTING SNOW LIKELY IN THE WIND PRONE AREAS OF
SOUTHEAST WYOMING THROUGH MID DAY THURSDAY...

...BLIZZARD CONDITIONS POSSIBLE ALONG INTERSTATE 80 WEST OF
LARAMIE THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY...WITH HEAVY SNOW LIKELY
SPREADING INTO THE INTERSTATE 25 CORRIDOR...

* WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, periods of blowing
snow expected. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow and
blowing snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 10
inches with locally higher amounts possible. Wind gusts up to
40 MPH possible.

* WHERE...Interstate 80 Summit between Laramie and Cheyenne.

* WHEN...Winter Weather Advisory until 2 PM MST Thursday. The
Winter Storm Watch is in effect from 2 PM Thursday until 5 AM
MST Saturday.

* IMPACTS...Travel may be extremely dangerous or impossible,
especially on Thursday night and Friday due to icy, snow
covered roads and low visibility.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM MST THURSDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE FRIDAY NIGHT
